mods.abstract: $100 REWARD. RANAWAY from the Plantation of the undersigned, near Opelousas, La., on the night of the 2d inst , the following negroes, to wit : HAMMOCK, negro-man, aged about 24 years, (black,) 6 feet high, sharp featured, quick spoken, a carpenter by trade, can read and write, and had, when he left, a black valise well filled, has writing materials with him. HENRY, griff boy, aged 27 years, tall, slender, and round shouldered, voice a little effeminate, (rather shrill), height 6 feet. MOSES, negro-man, (black) low set and stout, height 5 feet 11 inches, and weighs about 175 lbs. All of the above negroes were purchased of traders in New Orleans, on the 25th and 30th ult , and had on, when they left, the apparel usually worn in a traders yard. A reward of Sixty Dollars, ($20 a head) for the apprehension of the same will be paid on their delivery to me in Opelousas, or on their incarceration in any Jail within the State, and $100 if taken without its limits. From information in my possession it is believed that these negroes will endeavor to pass through Texas on their way to Mexico. GEO. HILL. St. Landry, April 16th, 1859.
